# D&D Encounter Card Image Prompts

This file is only for the Encounter Cards art on the D&D starter page.

## Save generated files to
`/Users/dustingamble/Documents/New project/lifeguidetool/dnd-assets/`

## Required filenames
- `monster-mudfoot-scout.png`
- `monster-cave-bat-swarm.png`
- `monster-bramble-wolf.png`
- `encounter-festival-reward.png`

## Global style block (append to each prompt)
"Family-friendly fantasy illustration, tabletop RPG style, cinematic lighting, expressive but non-scary tone, no gore, no blood, no text overlays, high detail, clear silhouette, suitable for kids age 10-13."

## Optional negative prompt
"horror, gore, blood, photorealism, logo, watermark, text caption, distorted anatomy"

---

"A young goblin cave scout in patched leather gear, standing defensively with sling and curved blade, protecting smaller goblin children behind him, cave lantern glow, worried expression not evil, fantasy cave setting, empathy-forward encounter scene. [GLOBAL STYLE]"

**Ratio:** 16:9

"A swirling cloud of cave bats bursting from a cavern ceiling, dynamic wing motion around a party's lantern light, high-energy but not horror, readable composition with clear movement arcs, fantasy cave environment with glowing moss. [GLOBAL STYLE]"

## PROMPT 3: Bramble Wolf
**Filename:** `monster-bramble-wolf.png`  
**Ratio:** 16:9

"A wary forest wolf with bramble and leaf details in its fur, circling cautiously on a woodland trail, alert posture and glowing eyes that look protective not monstrous, moonlit forest atmosphere, approachable for a first-time kids campaign. [GLOBAL STYLE]"

## PROMPT 4: Festival Reward Card Art
**Filename:** `encounter-festival-reward.png`  
**Ratio:** 16:9

"Fantasy village festival celebration at night, heroes receiving medals, warm lantern light, confetti and banners, joyful crowd including townsfolk and goblin children together, uplifting ending image for reward card. [GLOBAL STYLE]"

---

## Consistency tips
- Keep color palette aligned with your existing story images (cool blues + warm lantern gold).
- Keep monster tone adventurous, not terrifying.
- Reuse the same rendering model/style preset for all four images.
